p: During the chemical characterization of M. urundeuva leaf essential oil, the presence of four major chemical markers was detected with intraspecific variability: α-pinene (87.85%) as the major constituent, trans-caryophyllene (1.57%), limonene (1.49%) and β-pinene (1.42%). The constituents were identified by mass spectrometry (GC-MS and GC/FID), shown in Table 1.
